meanings.definition: To graze (verb) land excessively, causing damage to the vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The cows were overgrazing the field, eating too much grass.
meanings.sent2: Farmers must prevent overgrazing to keep the land healthy.
meanings.sent3: The sheep had a party and ended up overgrazing the entire meadow!
meanings.sent4: The relentless sun overgrazing the fields of green, leaving them barren.
meanings.sent5: Overgrazing by the goats turned the lush pasture into a barren wasteland.

meanings.definition: The act of grazing (noun) land excessively, causing damage to the vegetation.
meanings.sent1: Overgrazing can lead to soil erosion and loss of biodiversity.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalists were concerned about the overgrazing in the national park.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best overgrazing spot at the meadow was fierce.
meanings.sent4: The overgrazing of the hillside painted a sad picture of environmental degradation.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overgrazing were evident in the withered plants and exposed soil.
